column4: I am utterly confused concerning port forwarding using SSH -L and SSH -R. Lets suppose I have a machine 192.168.1.1 listening on port 80 -- I have another machine 192.168.1.2 ---- how can I cause it so that if I type: http://192.168.1.2          - it is somehow redirected to 192.168.1.1:80 ?
makes P1 on your machine a listening port
which directs traffic to port P2 of M1, via your ssh connection as U1 on M2
